original_text: Answer the following question. Which European country did not finally lose its territory in India until 1961? </s> During the 16th century, Portugal established a series of trading posts and fortifications in India. In 1510, it took Goa from Bijapur Sultanate which remained under Portuguese control until 1961 when it was annexed by India. All other European countries eventually lost their territories: France in 1954 to Vietnam; Netherlands East Indies (now Indonesia) in 1949 to Japan; Denmark's trading post on Seram Island sold to the Dutch Republic for 4800 Rixdollars in 1605 and finally British Raj gained independence on August 1947 now known as Pakistan & Union of India respectively. So the correct answer is "Portugal". </s> #### Portugal </s>
